bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the lower extremities
wounds and injuries of the knee joint
punctured and incised wounds of the knee joint
punctured wounds of the knee joint

revisionDesc.change: additional case copied from MSHWR, performed proofing of copy and XML encoding, and key terms identified

body.p: CASE 513.—Private D. R. Ewell, Co. G, 39th Massachusetts, received a knife wound of the left knee in April, 1864. He was successively admitted to the regimental, Harewood, and Portsmouth Grove hospitals, and returned to duty May 26, 1864. He is not a pensioner.
